p: Notably, Symphyocladia latiuscula is a red macroalga that has been reported to produce compounds with virucidal antiviral activity against HSV-1 ( Figure 1). Vero cells infected with HSV-1 and treated with extracts from this microalga showed reduced plaque formation. The antiviral effect of these compounds has also been evaluated in a murine model skin infection, which showed decreased skin lesions compared to controls when administrated 4 h before infection and then three times per day for 6â€“10 days. Also, skin obtained from these treated and infected animals showed lesser plaque forming units than the control ( Park et al., 2014).
